title: Mozzy Good Wishes to You & Yours! - MozMoz logoMenu openMenu closeSearchMoz logo
description: As the holidays draw to a close and we prepare to welcome a brand-new year, we at Moz just want to thank you all for a wonderful, fulfilling 2017 on the blog.
content: Mozzy Good Wishes to You & Yours! Moz News By: Felicia Crawford December 25, 2017 Table of Contents Copied! By: Felicia Crawford December 25, 2017 Mozzy Good Wishes to You & Yours! Moz News As the long holiday weekend draws to a close and we prepare to welcome a brand-new year, we at Moz just want to thank you all for a wonderful, fulfilling year on the blog. Your colorful commentary, delightful debates, thrilling thumbs-up, and vivacious visits have made the past twelve months sparkle and shine (and with that, I'll bid the alliteration adieu). Our "card" features a cameo from a little Moz Dog you may recognize: the inimitable Lettie Pickles!At the Moz HQ, we practice a multitude of holiday traditions. Whether it's Mozzers gathering in the common room (affectionately named "Roger") to light candles on the menorah during Hanukkah, trading and stealing gifts for the company-wide White Elephant exchange (someone won a bonafide Commodore 64 this year!), or getting our boogie and our board gaming on at the Moz holiday party, we try to honor this special season with a healthy mix of reverence and good old-fashioned fun. The folks who come to our blog for digital marketing advice hail from almost every remote corner of the world (we know; we looked at our analytics ;). This week, when things tend to slow down and it's just a little more difficult than usual to get anyone to reply to your emails, we'd love to invite you to share your own unique tales and traditions in the comments. What's your favorite way to celebrate, in the office and at home? What mishaps and magical moments alike filled your days, and what's your resolution for 2018? Let's take a little breather as we gear up for all the new projects and responsibilities awaiting us just around the corner and share with each other; after all, that's what being a community is all about! :) Copied! Back to Top
